trans-unit.source: Syntax for many statements and expressions includes the term <term>expression</term>, or a term for a specific kind of expression such as <varname>tableSubquery</varname>. Expressions are allowed in these specified places within statements.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax for many statements and expressions includes the term <term>expression</term>, or a term for a specific kind of expression such as <varname>tableSubquery</varname>.
Expressions are allowed in these specified places within statements.

target.mrk: Syntax for many statements and expressions includes the term <term>expression</term>, or a term for a specific kind of expression such as <varname>tableSubquery</varname>.
Expressions are allowed in these specified places within statements.

trans-unit.source: Some locations allow only a specific type of expression or one with a specific property. If not otherwise specified, an expression is permitted anywhere the word expression appears in the syntax. This includes:

seg-source.mrk: Some locations allow only a specific type of expression or one with a specific property.
If not otherwise specified, an expression is permitted anywhere the word expression appears in the syntax.

target.mrk: Some locations allow only a specific type of expression or one with a specific property.
If not otherwise specified, an expression is permitted anywhere the word expression appears in the syntax.

trans-unit.source: Of course, many other statements include these elements as building blocks, and so allow expressions as part of these elements.

seg-source.mrk: Of course, many other statements include these elements as building blocks, and so allow expressions as part of these elements.

target.mrk: Of course, many other statements include these elements as building blocks, and so allow expressions as part of these elements.

trans-unit.source: The following tables list all the possible SQL expressions and indicate where the expressions are allowed.

seg-source.mrk: The following tables list all the possible SQL expressions and indicate where the expressions are allowed.

target.mrk: The following tables list all the possible SQL expressions and indicate where the expressions are allowed.

trans-unit.source: General expressions are expressions that might result in a value of any type. The following table lists the types of general expressions.

seg-source.mrk: General expressions are expressions that might result in a value of any type.
The following table lists the types of general expressions.

target.mrk: General expressions are expressions that might result in a value of any type.
The following table lists the types of general expressions.

trans-unit.source: This table lists and describes the types of general SQL expressions.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of general SQL expressions.

target.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of general SQL expressions.

trans-unit.source: A <xref href="rrefcolumnname.dita#rrefcolumnname"><varname>columnName</varname></xref> that references the value of the column made visible to the expression containing the Column reference.

seg-source.mrk: A <xref href="rrefcolumnname.dita#rrefcolumnname"><varname>columnName</varname></xref> that references the value of the column made visible to the expression containing the Column reference.

target.mrk: A <xref href="rrefcolumnname.dita#rrefcolumnname"><varname>columnName</varname></xref> that references the value of the column made visible to the expression containing the Column reference.

trans-unit.source: You must qualify the <varname>columnName</varname> by the table name or correlation name if it is ambiguous.

seg-source.mrk: You must qualify the <varname>columnName</varname> by the table name or correlation name if it is ambiguous.

target.mrk: You must qualify the <varname>columnName</varname> by the table name or correlation name if it is ambiguous.

trans-unit.source: The qualifier of a columnName must be the correlation name, if a correlation name is given to a table that is in a FROM clause. The table name is no longer visible as a columnName qualifier once it has been aliased by a correlation name.

seg-source.mrk: The qualifier of a <varname>columnName</varname> must be the correlation name, if a correlation name is given to a table that is in a <xref href="rrefsqlj21583.dita#rrefsqlj21583">FROM clause</xref>.
The table name is no longer visible as a columnName qualifier once it has been aliased by a correlation name.

target.mrk: The qualifier of a <varname>columnName</varname> must be the correlation name, if a correlation name is given to a table that is in a <xref href="rrefsqlj21583.dita#rrefsqlj21583">FROM clause</xref>.
The table name is no longer visible as a columnName qualifier once it has been aliased by a correlation name.

trans-unit.source: Allowed in selectExpressions, UPDATE statements, and the WHERE clauses of data manipulation statements.

seg-source.mrk: Allowed in selectExpressions, UPDATE statements, and the WHERE clauses of data manipulation statements.

target.mrk: Allowed in selectExpressions, UPDATE statements, and the WHERE clauses of data manipulation statements.

trans-unit.source: Most built-in data types typically have constants associated with them (as shown in <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Most built-in data types typically have constants associated with them (as shown in <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>).

target.mrk: Most built-in data types typically have constants associated with them (as shown in <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>).

trans-unit.source: NULL is an untyped constant representing the unknown value.

seg-source.mrk: NULL is an untyped constant representing the unknown value.

target.mrk: NULL is an untyped constant representing the unknown value.

trans-unit.source: Allowed in CAST expressions or in INSERT VALUES lists and UPDATE SET clauses. Using it in a CAST expression gives it a specific data type.

seg-source.mrk: Allowed in CAST expressions or in INSERT VALUES lists and UPDATE SET clauses.
Using it in a CAST expression gives it a specific data type.

target.mrk: Allowed in CAST expressions or in INSERT VALUES lists and UPDATE SET clauses.
Using it in a CAST expression gives it a specific data type.

trans-unit.source: A dynamic parameter is a parameter to an SQL statement for which the value is not specified when the statement is created. Instead, the statement has a question mark (?) as a placeholder for each dynamic parameter. See <xref href="crefsqlj29911.dita#crefsqlj29911"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: A dynamic parameter is a parameter to an SQL statement for which the value is not specified when the statement is created.
Instead, the statement has a question mark (?) as a placeholder for each dynamic parameter.

target.mrk: A dynamic parameter is a parameter to an SQL statement for which the value is not specified when the statement is created.
Instead, the statement has a question mark (?) as a placeholder for each dynamic parameter.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic parameters are permitted only in prepared statements. You must specify values for them before the prepared statement is executed. The values specified must match the types expected.

seg-source.mrk: Dynamic parameters are permitted only in prepared statements.
You must specify values for them before the prepared statement is executed.
The values specified must match the types expected.

target.mrk: Dynamic parameters are permitted only in prepared statements.
You must specify values for them before the prepared statement is executed.
The values specified must match the types expected.

trans-unit.source: Allowed anywhere in an expression where the data type can be easily deduced. See <xref href="crefsqlj29911.dita#crefsqlj29911"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Allowed anywhere in an expression where the data type can be easily deduced.

target.mrk: Allowed anywhere in an expression where the data type can be easily deduced.

trans-unit.source: Lets you specify the type of NULL or of a dynamic parameter or convert a value to another type. See <xref href="rrefsqlj33562.dita#rrefsqlj33562"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Lets you specify the type of NULL or of a dynamic parameter or convert a value to another type.

target.mrk: Lets you specify the type of NULL or of a dynamic parameter or convert a value to another type.

trans-unit.source: Subquery that returns a single row with a single column. See .

seg-source.mrk: Subquery that returns a single row with a single column.

target.mrk: Subquery that returns a single row with a single column.

trans-unit.source: Subquery that returns more than one column and more than one row. See tableSubquery.

seg-source.mrk: Subquery that returns more than one column and more than one row.

target.mrk: Subquery that returns more than one column and more than one row.

trans-unit.source: Allowed as a tableExpression in a FROM clause and with EXISTS, IN, and quantified comparisons.

seg-source.mrk: Allowed as a tableExpression in a FROM clause and with EXISTS, IN, and quantified comparisons.

target.mrk: Allowed as a tableExpression in a FROM clause and with EXISTS, IN, and quantified comparisons.

trans-unit.source: A conditional expression chooses an expression to evaluate based on a boolean test. Conditional expressions include the <xref href="rrefcase.dita#rrefcase">CASE expression</xref>, the <xref href="rrefcasenullif.dita#rrefcasenullif">NULLIF function</xref>, and the <xref href="rreffunccoalesce.dita#rreffunccoalesce">COALESCE function</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: A conditional expression chooses an expression to evaluate based on a boolean test.

Conditional expressions include the <xref href="rrefcase.dita#rrefcase">CASE expression</xref>, the <xref href="rrefcasenullif.dita#rrefcasenullif">NULLIF function</xref>, and the <xref href="rreffunccoalesce.dita#rreffunccoalesce">COALESCE function</xref>.

target.mrk: A conditional expression chooses an expression to evaluate based on a boolean test.

Conditional expressions include the <xref href="rrefcase.dita#rrefcase">CASE expression</xref>, the <xref href="rrefcasenullif.dita#rrefcasenullif">NULLIF function</xref>, and the <xref href="rreffunccoalesce.dita#rreffunccoalesce">COALESCE function</xref>.

trans-unit.source: Boolean expressions are expressions that result in boolean values. Most general expressions can result in boolean values. See <xref href="rrefsqlj23075.dita#rrefsqlj23075"></xref> for more information and a table of operators.

seg-source.mrk: Boolean expressions are expressions that result in boolean values.
Most general expressions can result in boolean values.
See <xref href="rrefsqlj23075.dita#rrefsqlj23075"></xref> for more information and a table of operators.

target.mrk: Boolean expressions are expressions that result in boolean values.
Most general expressions can result in boolean values.
See <xref href="rrefsqlj23075.dita#rrefsqlj23075"></xref> for more information and a table of operators.

trans-unit.source: Numeric expressions are expressions that result in numeric values. Most of the general expressions can result in numeric values. Numeric values have one of the following types:

seg-source.mrk: Numeric expressions are expressions that result in numeric values.
Most of the general expressions can result in numeric values.
Numeric values have one of the following types:

target.mrk: Numeric expressions are expressions that result in numeric values.
Most of the general expressions can result in numeric values.
Numeric values have one of the following types:

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the types of numeric expressions.

seg-source.mrk: The following table lists the types of numeric expressions.

target.mrk: The following table lists the types of numeric expressions.

trans-unit.source: This table lists and describes the types of numeric SQL expressions.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of numeric SQL expressions.

target.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of numeric SQL expressions.

trans-unit.source: Evaluate the expected math operation on the operands. If both operands are the same type, the result type is not promoted, so the division operator on integers results in an integer that is the truncation of the actual numeric result. When types are mixed, they are promoted as described in <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Evaluate the expected math operation on the operands.
If both operands are the same type, the result type is not promoted, so the division operator on integers results in an integer that is the truncation of the actual numeric result.
When types are mixed, they are promoted as described in <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>.

target.mrk: Evaluate the expected math operation on the operands.
If both operands are the same type, the result type is not promoted, so the division operator on integers results in an integer that is the truncation of the actual numeric result.
When types are mixed, they are promoted as described in <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: Unary + is a noop (i.e., +4 is the same as 4). Unary - is the same as multiplying the value by -1, effectively changing its sign.

seg-source.mrk: Unary + is a noop (i.e., +4 is the same as 4).
Unary - is the same as multiplying the value by -1, effectively changing its sign.

target.mrk: Unary + is a noop (i.e., +4 is the same as 4).
Unary - is the same as multiplying the value by -1, effectively changing its sign.

trans-unit.source: Returns the average of a set of numeric values. See <xref href="rrefsqlj32693.dita#rrefsqlj32693"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the average of a set of numeric values.

target.mrk: Returns the average of a set of numeric values.

trans-unit.source: Returns the sum of a set of numeric values. See <xref href="rrefsqlj13083.dita#rrefsqlj13083"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the sum of a set of numeric values.

target.mrk: Returns the sum of a set of numeric values.

trans-unit.source: Returns the number of characters in a character or bit string. See <xref href="rrefsqlj16762.dita#rrefsqlj16762"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the number of characters in a character or bit string.

target.mrk: Returns the number of characters in a character or bit string.

trans-unit.source: Returns the count of a set of values. See <xref href="rrefsqlj38716.dita#rrefsqlj38716"></xref>, <xref href="rrefsqlj66113.dita#rrefsqlj66113"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the count of a set of values.

target.mrk: Returns the count of a set of values.

trans-unit.source: Character expressions are expressions that result in a CHAR or VARCHAR value. Most general expressions can result in a CHAR or VARCHAR value. The following table lists the types of character expressions.

seg-source.mrk: Character expressions are expressions that result in a CHAR or VARCHAR value.
Most general expressions can result in a CHAR or VARCHAR value.
The following table lists the types of character expressions.

target.mrk: Character expressions are expressions that result in a CHAR or VARCHAR value.
Most general expressions can result in a CHAR or VARCHAR value.
The following table lists the types of character expressions.

trans-unit.source: This table lists and describes the types of character SQL expressions.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of character SQL expressions.

target.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of character SQL expressions.

trans-unit.source: A CHAR or VARCHAR value that uses wildcards.

seg-source.mrk: A CHAR or VARCHAR value that uses wildcards.

target.mrk: A CHAR or VARCHAR value that uses wildcards.

trans-unit.source: The wildcards % and _ make a character string a pattern against which the LIKE operator can look for a match.

seg-source.mrk: The wildcards % and _ make a character string a pattern against which the LIKE operator can look for a match.

target.mrk: The wildcards % and _ make a character string a pattern against which the LIKE operator can look for a match.

trans-unit.source: In a concatenation expression, the concatenation operator, "||", concatenates its right operand to the end of its left operand. Operates on character and bit strings. See <xref href="rrefsqlj40899.dita#rrefsqlj40899"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: In a concatenation expression, the concatenation operator, "||", concatenates its right operand to the end of its left operand.
Operates on character and bit strings.

target.mrk: In a concatenation expression, the concatenation operator, "||", concatenates its right operand to the end of its left operand.
Operates on character and bit strings.

trans-unit.source: The built-in string functions act on a String and return a string. See <xref href="rrefsqlj97870.dita#rrefsqlj97870"></xref>, <xref href="rrefsqlj42049.dita#rrefsqlj42049"></xref>, <xref href="rrefsqlj32613.dita#rrefsqlj32613"></xref>, <xref href="rreftrimfunc.dita#rreftrimfunc"></xref>, <xref href="rrefsqlj93082.dita#rrefsqlj93082"></xref>, and <xref href="rrefsqlj29930.dita#rrefsqlj29930"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: The built-in string functions act on a String and return a string.

target.mrk: The built-in string functions act on a String and return a string.

trans-unit.source: User functions return information about the current user as a String. See <xref href="rrefsqlj42324.dita#rrefsqlj42324"></xref>, <xref href="rrefsqlj25228.dita#rrefsqlj25228"></xref>, and <xref href="rrefsqlj42476.dita#rrefsqlj42476"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: User functions return information about the current user as a String.

target.mrk: User functions return information about the current user as a String.

trans-unit.source: A date or time expression results in a DATE, TIME, or TIMESTAMP value. Most of the general expressions can result in a date or time value. The following table lists the types of date and time expressions.

seg-source.mrk: A date or time expression results in a DATE, TIME, or TIMESTAMP value.
Most of the general expressions can result in a date or time value.
The following table lists the types of date and time expressions.

target.mrk: A date or time expression results in a DATE, TIME, or TIMESTAMP value.
Most of the general expressions can result in a date or time value.
The following table lists the types of date and time expressions.

trans-unit.source: This table lists and describes the types of date and time SQL expressions.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of date and time SQL expressions.

target.mrk: This table lists and describes the types of date and time SQL expressions.
